00109 
00127 cache_entry_t * cache_inode_operate_cached_dirent( cache_entry_t           * pentry_parent, 
00128                                                    fsal_name_t             * pname,
00129                                                    fsal_name_t             * newname,
00130                                                    cache_inode_dirent_op_t   dirent_op,
00131                                                    cache_inode_status_t    * pstatus )
00132 {
00133   cache_entry_t * pdir_chain = NULL ;
00134   cache_entry_t * pentry     = NULL ;
00135   fsal_status_t   fsal_status ; 
00136   int i = 0 ;
00137   
00138   /* Set the return default to CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS */
00139   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00140 
00141   /* Sanity check */
00142   if( pentry_parent->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING &&
00143       pentry_parent->internal_md.type != DIR_CONTINUE )
00144     {
00145       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00146       
00147       return NULL ;
00148     }
00149 
00150   /* Try to look into the dir and its dir_cont. At this point, it must be said than lock on dir_cont are
00151    *  taken when a lock is previously acquired on the related dir_begin */
00152   pdir_chain = pentry_parent ;
00153   
00154   do
00155     {
00156       /* Is this entry known ? */
00157       if( pdir_chain->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
00158         {
00159           for( i = 0 ; i < CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ; i++ )
00160             {
00161 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE
00162                     printf( "DIR_BEGINNING %d | %d | %s | %s\n", 
00163                       pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].active, 
00164                       pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].pentry->internal_md.valid_state, 
00165                       pname->name,  pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].name.name ) ; 
00166 #endif
00167               if( pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].active == VALID &&
00168                   pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].pentry->internal_md.valid_state == VALID &&
00169                   !FSAL_namecmp( pname,  &(pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].name) ) )
00170                 {
00171                   /* Entry was found */
00172                   pentry = pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].pentry ;
00173                   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00174                   break ;
00175                 }    
00176             }
00177           
00178           if( pentry != NULL )
00179             break ; /* Exit the do...while loop */
00180           
00181           /* Do we have to go on browsing the cache_inode ? */
00182           /* We have to check if eod is reached and no pentry found */
00183           if( pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.end_of_dir == END_OF_DIR )
00184             {
00185               pentry = NULL ;
00186               *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_NOT_FOUND ;
00187               break ;
00188             }
00189           
00190           /* Next step, release the lock and acquire a new one */
00191           pdir_chain = pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.pdir_cont ;
00192         }
00193       else
00194         {
00195           /* Entry is no DIR_BEGINNING, it is of type DIR_CONTINUE */
00196           for( i = 0 ; i < CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ; i++ )
00197             {
00198               /*
00199                printf( "DIR_CONTINUE %d | %d | %s | %s\n", 
00200                        pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].active, 
00201                        pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].pentry->internal_md.valid_state, 
00202                        name.name, 
00203                        pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].name.name ) ; */
00204                
00205               if( pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].active == VALID &&
00206                   pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].pentry->internal_md.valid_state == VALID &&
00207                   !FSAL_namecmp( pname,  &(pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].name) ) )
00208                 {
00209                   /* Entry was found */
00210                   pentry = pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].pentry ;
00211                   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00212                   break ;
00213                 }    
00214             }
00215           
00216            if( pentry != NULL )
00217              break ; /* Exit the do...while loop */
00218 
00219           /* Do we have to go on browsing the cache_inode ? */
00220           if( pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.end_of_dir == END_OF_DIR ) 
00221             {
00222               pentry = NULL ;
00223               *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_NOT_FOUND ;
00224               break ;
00225             }
00226           /* Next step */
00227           pdir_chain = pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_cont ;
00228         }
00229       
00230     } while( pentry == NULL ) ;
00231 
00232   /* Did we find something */
00233   if( pentry != NULL )
00234     {
00235       /* Yes, we did ! */
00236       switch( dirent_op )
00237         {
00238         case CACHE_INODE_DIRENT_OP_REMOVE:
00239           /* Related DIR_BEGINNING or DIR_CONTINUE is pointed by pdir_chain, entry is the i-th is dir_entries 
00240            * The dirent entry is removed by being set invalid */
00241             
00242           if( pdir_chain->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
00243             {
00244               pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].active =INVALID ;
00245               pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.nbactive -= 1 ;
00246               *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00247             }
00248           else if( pdir_chain->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE )
00249             {
00250               pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].active =INVALID ;
00251               pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.nbactive -= 1 ;
00252               *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00253             }
00254           else
00255             *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00256           break ;
00257          
00258         case CACHE_INODE_DIRENT_OP_RENAME:
00259           /* Entry to rename is the i-th in pdir_chain */
00260           if(  pdir_chain->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
00261             {
00262                 fsal_status = FSAL_namecpy(  &(pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].name), newname ) ;
00263             }
00264           else
00265             {   
00266                 fsal_status = FSAL_namecpy(  &(pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].name), newname ) ;
00267             }
00268 
00269           if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00270             {
00271                 *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00272             } 
00273           else
00274             {
00275                 *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00276             }
00277           break ; 
00278 
00279         default:
00280           /* Should never occurs, in any case, it cost nothing to handle this situation */
00281           *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00282           break ;
00283           
00284         } /* switch */      
00285     }
00286 
00287   /* Last lock released */
00288 
00289   return pentry ;
00290 } /* cache_inode_operate_cached_dirent */
00291 
00292 #ifdef _TOTO
00293 
00308 cache_entry_t * cache_inode_lookup_cached_dirent( cache_entry_t        * pentry_parent, 
00309                                                   fsal_name_t          * pname,
00310                                                   cache_inode_status_t * pstatus )
00311 {
00312   /* Set the return default to CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS */
00313   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00314 
00315    /* Sanity check */
00316   if( pentry_parent->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING &&
00317       pentry_parent->internal_md.type != DIR_CONTINUE )
00318     {
00319       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00320       return NULL ;
00321     }
00322   return cache_inode_operate_cached_dirent( pentry_parent, *pname, NULL, CACHE_INODE_DIRENT_OP_LOOKUP, pstatus ) ;
00323 } /* cache_inode_lookup_cached_dirent */
00324 #endif
00325 
00348 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_add_cached_dirent( cache_entry_t        *  pentry_parent,
00349                                                     fsal_name_t          *  pname, 
00350                                                     cache_entry_t        *  pentry_added,
00351                                                     cache_entry_t        ** ppentry_next,
00352                                                     hash_table_t         *  ht,
00353                                                     cache_inode_client_t *  pclient,
00354                                                     fsal_op_context_t          *  pcontext, 
00355                                                     cache_inode_status_t *  pstatus )
00356 {  
00357    cache_entry_t              * pdir_chain = NULL ;
00358    cache_entry_t              * pentry = NULL ;
00359    fsal_status_t                fsal_status ;
00360    cache_inode_fsal_data_t      fsdata ;
00361    cache_inode_parent_entry_t * next_parent_entry = NULL ;
00362 
00363    int i          = 0 ;
00364    int slot_index = 0 ;
00365    
00366    /* For the moment, we add no error...
00367     * Get ride of former *pstatus value */
00368    *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00369    
00370    /* Sanity check */
00371    if( pentry_parent->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING &&
00372        pentry_parent->internal_md.type != DIR_CONTINUE )
00373      {
00374        *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00375        return *pstatus ;
00376      }
00377    
00378    /* We don't known where to write, we have to seek for an empty place */
00379    /* Search loop. We look for an empty slot in a dirent array */
00380    pdir_chain = pentry_parent ;
00381    do
00382      {
00383        
00384        if( pdir_chain->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
00385          {
00386            /* DIR_BEGINNING management */
00387            
00388            if( pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.nbactive  != CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE )
00389              {
00390                for( i = 0 ; i < CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ; i++ )
00391                  {
00392                    if(  pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].active == INVALID ||
00393                         pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].pentry == NULL )
00394                      {
00395                        /* slot found */
00396                        pentry = pdir_chain ;
00397                        slot_index = i ; 
00398                        break ;
00399                      }
00400                  }
00401              }
00402            
00403            /* Next step */
00404            if( pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.end_of_dir == END_OF_DIR )
00405              {
00406                /* Entry was not found, break the main loop */
00407                break ;
00408              }
00409            else
00410              {
00411                pdir_chain = pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.pdir_cont ;
00412              }
00413            
00414          }
00415        else if ( pdir_chain->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE )
00416          {
00417            /* DIR_CONTINUE management */
00418            
00419            if( pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.nbactive  != CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE )
00420              {
00421                for( i = 0 ; i < CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ; i++ )
00422                  {
00423                    if( pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].active == INVALID ||
00424                        pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].pentry == NULL )
00425                      {
00426                        pentry = pdir_chain ;
00427                        slot_index = i ;
00428                        break ;
00429                      }
00430                  }
00431              }
00432            
00433            
00434            /* Next step */
00435            if( pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.end_of_dir == END_OF_DIR )
00436              {
00437                /* Entry was not found, break the main loop */
00438                break ;
00439              }
00440            else
00441              {
00442                pdir_chain = pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_cont ;
00443              }
00444          }
00445         else
00446          {
00447              /* entry not found */
00448              DisplayLog( "cache_inode_add_cached_dirent: Critical Warning: a non-directory type has been detected in a dir_chain !!!" ) ;
00449              *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE;
00450              return *pstatus ;             
00451          }
00452        
00453      } while( pentry == NULL ) ;
00454    
00455    
00456    /* If pentry is NULL, all the dirent are full and a new entry is needed */
00457    if( pentry == NULL )
00458      {
00459        /* Pointer pentry is NULL, a new entry DIR_CONTINUE is required */
00460        
00461        /* There may be previously invalidated dirents, in this case pdir_cont already exists
00462         * we won't allocate new things in this case and reuse the old ones 
00463         * This case is identified by pdir_chain->object.*.pdir_cont != NULL 
00464         */
00465        switch( pdir_chain->internal_md.type )
00466          {
00467          case DIR_BEGINNING:
00468            fsdata.handle = pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.handle ;
00469            fsdata.cookie = 1 ;
00470            pentry = pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.pdir_cont ;
00471            break ;
00472            
00473          case DIR_CONTINUE:
00474            fsdata.handle = pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->object.dir_begin.handle ;
00475            fsdata.cookie = pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.dir_cont_pos + 1 ;
00476            pentry = pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_cont ;
00477            break ;
00478          }
00479        
00480        /* Allocate a new DIR_CONTINUE to the dir chain if needed */
00481        if( pentry == NULL )
00482            
00483          if( ( pentry = cache_inode_new_entry( &fsdata, 
00484                                                NULL, 
00485                                                DIR_CONTINUE, 
00486                                                NULL,
00487                                                pdir_chain, 
00488                                                ht,
00489                                                pclient, 
00490                                                pcontext, 
00491                                                FALSE, /* this is population, no creation */
00492                                                pstatus ) ) == NULL )
00493            {
00494              return *pstatus ;
00495            }
00496            else
00497            {
00498                /* reset status in case it already exists,
00499                   so it is not propagated to caller */
00500                
00501                *pstatus = 0;
00502            }
00503 
00504        /* Chain the new entry with the pdir_chain */
00505        switch( pdir_chain->internal_md.type )
00506          {
00507          case DIR_BEGINNING:
00508            pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.pdir_cont = pentry ;
00509            pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.pdir_last = pentry ;
00510            pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.end_of_dir = TO_BE_CONTINUED ;
00511            pdir_chain->object.dir_begin.nbdircont += 1 ;
00512            break ;
00513            
00514          case DIR_CONTINUE:
00515            pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_cont = pentry ;
00516            
00517            pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.end_of_dir = TO_BE_CONTINUED ;
00518            
00519            pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->object.dir_begin.pdir_last = pentry ;
00520            pdir_chain->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->object.dir_begin.nbdircont += 1 ;
00521            break ;
00522          }
00523        
00524        
00525        /* slot to be used in the dirent array will be the first */
00526        slot_index = 0 ;
00527      }
00528    
00529    /* pentry is not NULL, if it was NULL a new DIR_CONTINUE has just been allocated */
00530 
00531 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00532   /* For debugging memory leaks */
00533    BuddySetDebugLabel( "cache_inode_parent_entry_t" ) ;
00534 #endif
00535 
00536    GET_PREALLOC( next_parent_entry, 
00537                  pclient->pool_parent,
00538                  pclient->nb_pre_parent,
00539                  cache_inode_parent_entry_t,      
00540                  next_alloc ) ;
00541 
00542 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00543    /* For debugging memory leaks */
00544    BuddySetDebugLabel( "N/A" ) ;
00545 #endif
00546 
00547    if( next_parent_entry == NULL )
00548      {
00549        *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_MALLOC_ERROR ;
00550        pentry = NULL ;
00551        return *pstatus ;
00552      }
00553 
00554    /* Init the next_parent_entry variable */
00555    next_parent_entry->subdirpos   = 0 ;
00556    next_parent_entry->parent      = NULL ;
00557    next_parent_entry->next_parent = NULL ;
00558 
00559    
00560    if( pentry->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
00561      {
00562        pentry->object.dir_begin.nbactive += 1 ;
00563        
00564        pentry->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[slot_index].active = VALID ;
00565        pentry->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[slot_index].pentry = pentry_added ;
00566        
00567        fsal_status = FSAL_namecpy( &pentry->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[slot_index].name, pname ) ;
00568        if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00569          {
00570            *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ERROR ;
00571            pentry->object.dir_begin.nbactive -= 1 ;
00572            pentry = NULL ;
00573            return *pstatus ;
00574          }
00575      }
00576    else
00577      {
00578        /* DIR_CONTINUE */
00579        pentry->object.dir_cont.nbactive += 1 ;
00580        
00581        pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[slot_index].active = VALID ;
00582        pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[slot_index].pentry = pentry_added ;
00583        
00584        fsal_status = FSAL_namecpy( &pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[slot_index].name, pname ) ;
00585        if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00586          {
00587            *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ERROR ;
00588            pentry->object.dir_cont.nbactive -= 1 ;
00589            pentry = NULL ;
00590            return *pstatus ;
00591          }
00592        
00593        
00594      }
00595 
00596    /* link with the parent entry (insert as first entry) */ 
00597    next_parent_entry->subdirpos   = slot_index ;
00598    next_parent_entry->parent      = pentry ;
00599    next_parent_entry->next_parent = pentry_added->parent_list ;
00600    pentry_added->parent_list = next_parent_entry ;
00601    
00602    if( ppentry_next != NULL )
00603      {
00604        *ppentry_next = pentry ;
00605      }
00606    
00607    return *pstatus ;
00608 } /* cache_inode_add_cached_dirent */
00609 
00610 /*
00611  * cache_inode_invalidate_all_cached_dirent: Invalidates all the entries for a cached directory and its DIR_CONTINUE.
00612  *
00613  * Invalidates all the entries for a cached directory and its DIR_CONTINUE. No MT Safety managed here !!
00614  *
00615  * @param pentry_parent [INOUT] cache entry representing the directory to be managed.
00616  * @param ht [IN] hash table used for the cache, unused in this call.
00617  * @param pclient [INOUT] ressource allocated by the client for the nfs management.
00618  * @param pstatus [OUT] returned status.
00619  *
00620  * @return the same as *pstatus
00621  *
00622  */
00623 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_invalidate_all_cached_dirent(  cache_entry_t * pentry_dir,
00624                                                                 hash_table_t * ht,
00625                                                                 cache_inode_client_t * pclient,
00626                                                                 cache_inode_status_t *pstatus )
00627 {
00628   int i ;
00629   cache_entry_t * pentry = NULL ;
00630   
00631   /* Set the return default to CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS */
00632   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00633 
00634   /* Only DIR_BEGINNING entries are concerned */
00635   if( pentry_dir->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING )
00636     {
00637       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00638       return *pstatus ;
00639     }
00640   
00641   /* Get ride of entries cached in the DIR_BEGINNING */
00642   pentry = pentry_dir ;
00643 
00644   for( i = 0 ; i < CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ; i++ )
00645     pentry->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].active = INVALID ;
00646   pentry->object.dir_begin.nbactive = 0 ;
00647 
00648 
00649   /* Loop on the next DIR_CONTINUE */
00650   pentry = pentry->object.dir_begin.pdir_cont ;
00651   
00652   while( pentry != NULL )
00653     {
00654       for( i = 0 ; i < CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ; i++ )
00655         pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].active = INVALID ;
00656       pentry->object.dir_cont.nbactive = 0 ;
00657       
00658       pentry =  pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_cont ;
00659     }
00660   
00661   /* Reinit the fields */
00662   pentry_dir->object.dir_begin.has_been_readdir = CACHE_INODE_NO ;
00663   pentry_dir->object.dir_begin.end_of_dir = END_OF_DIR ;
00664   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00665   
00666   return *pstatus ;
00667 } /* cache_inode_invalidate_all_cached_dirent */
00668 
00684 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_remove_cached_dirent( cache_entry_t        * pentry_parent, 
00685                                                        fsal_name_t          * pname, 
00686                                                        hash_table_t         * ht,
00687                                                        cache_inode_client_t * pclient,
00688                                                        cache_inode_status_t * pstatus )
00689 {
00690   cache_entry_t              * removed_pentry = NULL ;
00691   cache_inode_parent_entry_t * parent_iter    = NULL ;
00692   cache_inode_parent_entry_t * previous_iter  = NULL ;
00693   int                          found          = 0 ;
00694   
00695   /* Set the return default to CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS */
00696   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00697 
00698   /* Sanity check */
00699   if( pentry_parent->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING &&
00700       pentry_parent->internal_md.type != DIR_CONTINUE )
00701     {
00702       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00703       return *pstatus ;
00704     }
00705 
00706   /* BUGAZOMEU: Ne pas oublier de jarter un dir_cont dont toutes les entrees sont inactives */
00707   if( ( removed_pentry = cache_inode_operate_cached_dirent( pentry_parent, 
00708                                                             pname, 
00709                                                             NULL,
00710                                                             CACHE_INODE_DIRENT_OP_REMOVE, 
00711                                                             pstatus ) ) == NULL )
00712     return *pstatus ;
00713 
00714   /* Remove the parent entry from the entry whose dirent is removed */
00715   for( previous_iter = NULL, parent_iter = removed_pentry->parent_list ; 
00716        (parent_iter != NULL) && (parent_iter->parent != NULL ) ;
00717        previous_iter = parent_iter, parent_iter = parent_iter->next_parent )
00718     {
00719       if( parent_iter->parent == pentry_parent || 
00720           ( parent_iter->parent->internal_md.type           == DIR_CONTINUE &&
00721             parent_iter->parent->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin == pentry_parent ) )
00722         {
00723           found = 1 ;
00724           break ;
00725         }
00726     }
00727   
00728   /* Check for pentry cache inconsistency */
00729   if( !found )
00730     {
00731       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_INCONSISTENT_ENTRY ;
00732     }
00733   else
00734     {
00735       if(  previous_iter == NULL )
00736         {
00737           /* this is the first parent */
00738           removed_pentry->parent_list = parent_iter->next_parent ;
00739         }
00740       else
00741         {
00742           /* This is not the first parent */
00743           previous_iter->next_parent = parent_iter->next_parent ;
00744         }
00745       
00746       /* It is now time to put parent_iter back to its pool */
00747       RELEASE_PREALLOC( parent_iter,  pclient->pool_parent, next_alloc ) ;
00748       
00749     }
00750   return CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00751 } /* cache_inode_remove_cached_dirent */
00752 
00753 
00767 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_readdir_populate(  cache_entry_t           * pentry_dir, 
00768                                                     hash_table_t            * ht,
00769                                                     cache_inode_client_t    * pclient,
00770                                                     fsal_op_context_t       * pcontext, 
00771                                                     cache_inode_status_t    * pstatus) 
00772 {
00773   fsal_dir_t         fsal_dirhandle ;
00774   fsal_status_t      fsal_status ;
00775   fsal_attrib_list_t dir_attributes ;
00776   
00777   fsal_cookie_t   begin_cookie ;
00778   fsal_cookie_t   end_cookie ;
00779   fsal_count_t    nbfound ;
00780   fsal_count_t    iter ;
00781   fsal_boolean_t  fsal_eod ;
00782 
00783   cache_entry_t *           pentry             = NULL ;
00784   cache_entry_t *           next_pentry_parent = NULL ;
00785   cache_entry_t *           pentry_parent      = pentry_dir ;
00786   fsal_attrib_list_t        object_attributes ;
00787   
00788   cache_inode_create_arg_t  create_arg;
00789   cache_inode_file_type_t   type ;
00790   cache_inode_status_t      cache_status ;
00791   fsal_dirent_t             array_dirent[FSAL_READDIR_SIZE+20] ;
00792   cache_inode_fsal_data_t   new_entry_fsdata ;
00793 
00794   /* Set the return default to CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS */
00795   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00796   
00797   /* Only DIR_BEGINNING entries are concerned */
00798   if( pentry_dir->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING )
00799     {
00800       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00801       return *pstatus ;
00802     }
00803   
00804   /* If directory is already populated , there is no job to do */
00805   if( pentry_dir->object.dir_begin.has_been_readdir == CACHE_INODE_YES )
00806     {
00807       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00808       return *pstatus ;
00809      }
00810 
00811   /* Invalidate all the dirents */
00812   if( cache_inode_invalidate_all_cached_dirent( pentry_dir,
00813                                                 ht, 
00814                                                 pclient,
00815                                                 pstatus ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00816     return *pstatus ;
00817   
00818   /* Open the directory */
00819   dir_attributes.asked_attributes = pclient->attrmask  ;
00820 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00821   fsal_status = MFSL_opendir( &pentry_dir->mobject,
00822                               pcontext, 
00823                               &pclient->mfsl_context,
00824                               &fsal_dirhandle, 
00825                               &dir_attributes ) ;
00826 #else
00827   fsal_status = FSAL_opendir( &pentry_dir->object.dir_begin.handle, 
00828                               pcontext, 
00829                               &fsal_dirhandle, 
00830                               &dir_attributes ) ;
00831 #endif
00832   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00833     {
00834       *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00835 
00836       if( fsal_status.major == ERR_FSAL_STALE ) 
00837         {
00838            cache_inode_status_t kill_status ;
00839 
00840            DisplayLog( "cache_inode_readdir: Stale FSAL File Handle detected for pentry = %p", pentry_dir ) ;
00841 
00842            if( cache_inode_kill_entry( pentry_dir, ht, pclient, &kill_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00843                DisplayLog( "cache_inode_readdir: Could not kill entry %p, status = %u", pentry_dir, kill_status ) ;
00844 
00845            *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ESTALE ;
00846         }
00847       return *pstatus ;
00848     }
00849   
00850   /* Loop for readding the directory */
00851   begin_cookie = FSAL_READDIR_FROM_BEGINNING ;
00852   end_cookie   = FSAL_READDIR_FROM_BEGINNING ;
00853   fsal_eod     = FALSE ;
00854  
00855  
00856   do
00857     {
00858 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00859        fsal_status = MFSL_readdir( &fsal_dirhandle,
00860                                    begin_cookie, 
00861                                    pclient->attrmask, 
00862                                    FSAL_READDIR_SIZE * sizeof( fsal_dirent_t ),
00863                                    array_dirent,
00864                                    &end_cookie, 
00865                                    &nbfound, 
00866                                    &fsal_eod,
00867                                    &pclient->mfsl_context );
00868 #else
00869        fsal_status = FSAL_readdir( &fsal_dirhandle, 
00870                                     begin_cookie, 
00871                                     pclient->attrmask, 
00872                                     FSAL_READDIR_SIZE * sizeof( fsal_dirent_t ),
00873                                     array_dirent,
00874                                     &end_cookie, 
00875                                     &nbfound, 
00876                                     &fsal_eod ) ;
00877 #endif
00878       
00879        if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00880          {
00881            *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00882            return *pstatus ;
00883          }
00884       
00885         for( iter = 0 ; iter < nbfound ; iter++ )
00886         {
00887           DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, 
00888                              NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
00889                              "cache readdir populate found entry %s", array_dirent[iter].name.name ) ;
00890           
00891           /* It is not needed to cache '.' and '..' */
00892           if( !FSAL_namecmp( &(array_dirent[iter].name), &FSAL_DOT ) ||
00893               !FSAL_namecmp( &(array_dirent[iter].name), &FSAL_DOT_DOT ) )
00894             {
00895               DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs,
00896                                  NIV_FULL_DEBUG,
00897                                  "cache readdir populate : do not cache . and .." ) ;
00898               continue ;
00899             }
00900           
00901           /* If dir entry is a symbolic link, its content has to be read */
00902           if( ( type = cache_inode_fsal_type_convert( array_dirent[iter].attributes.type ) ) == SYMBOLIC_LINK )
00903             {
00904 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00905               mfsl_object_t  tmp_mfsl ;
00906 #endif 
00907               /* Let's read the link for caching its value */
00908               object_attributes.asked_attributes = pclient->attrmask ;
00909 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00910               tmp_mfsl.handle = array_dirent[iter].handle ;
00911               fsal_status = MFSL_readlink( &tmp_mfsl,
00912                                            pcontext, 
00913                                            &pclient->mfsl_context,
00914                                            &create_arg.link_content, 
00915                                            &object_attributes  ) ;
00916 #else
00917               fsal_status = FSAL_readlink( &array_dirent[iter].handle,
00918                                            pcontext, 
00919                                            &create_arg.link_content, 
00920                                            &object_attributes  ) ;
00921 #endif
00922               if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00923                 {
00924                   *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00925 
00926                    if( fsal_status.major == ERR_FSAL_STALE )
00927                      {
00928                        cache_inode_status_t kill_status ;
00929 
00930                        DisplayLog( "cache_inode_readdir: Stale FSAL File Handle detected for pentry = %p", pentry_dir ) ;
00931 
00932                        if( cache_inode_kill_entry( pentry_dir, ht, pclient, &kill_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00933                                 DisplayLog( "cache_inode_readdir: Could not kill entry %p, status = %u", pentry_dir, kill_status ) ;
00934 
00935                        *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ESTALE ;
00936                       }
00937 
00938                   return *pstatus ;
00939                 }
00940             }
00941          
00942           /* Try adding the entry, if it exists then this existing entry is returned */
00943           new_entry_fsdata.handle = array_dirent[iter].handle ;
00944           new_entry_fsdata.cookie = 0 ;
00945           
00946           if( ( pentry = cache_inode_new_entry( &new_entry_fsdata, 
00947                                                 &array_dirent[iter].attributes,
00948                                                 type, 
00949                                                 &create_arg,
00950                                                 NULL, 
00951                                                 ht, 
00952                                                 pclient, 
00953                                                 pcontext,
00954                                                 FALSE, /* This is population and no creation */
00955                                                 pstatus ) ) == NULL )
00956             return *pstatus ;
00957           
00958           cache_status = cache_inode_add_cached_dirent( pentry_parent,
00959                                                         &(array_dirent[iter].name), 
00960                                                         pentry,
00961                                                         &next_pentry_parent,
00962                                                         ht, 
00963                                                         pclient, 
00964                                                         pcontext,
00965                                                         pstatus) ;
00966           
00967           
00968         if( cache_status != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS && cache_status != CACHE_INODE_ENTRY_EXISTS )
00969           return *pstatus ;
00970         
00971         }
00972 
00973       /* Step to next item in dir_chain */
00974       pentry_parent = next_pentry_parent ;  
00975      
00976       
00977       /* Get prepared for next step */
00978       begin_cookie = end_cookie ;
00979     } while( fsal_eod != TRUE ) ;
00980   
00981   /* Close the directory */
00982 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00983   fsal_status = MFSL_closedir( &fsal_dirhandle, &pclient->mfsl_context ) ;
00984 #else
00985   fsal_status = FSAL_closedir( &fsal_dirhandle ) ;
00986 #endif
00987   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00988     {
00989       *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00990       return *pstatus ;
00991     }
00992   
00993   /* End of work */ 
00994   pentry_dir->object.dir_begin.has_been_readdir = CACHE_INODE_YES ;
00995   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00996   return *pstatus ;
00997 } /* cache_inode_readdir_populate */
00998 
00999 
01022 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_readdir( cache_entry_t           * dir_pentry, 
01023                                           unsigned int              cookie,
01024                                           unsigned int              nbwanted, 
01025                                           unsigned int            * pnbfound,
01026                                           unsigned int            * pend_cookie,
01027                                           cache_inode_endofdir_t  * peod_met,
01028                                           cache_inode_dir_entry_t * dirent_array, 
01029                                           unsigned int            * cookie_array,
01030                                           hash_table_t            * ht,
01031                                           cache_inode_client_t    * pclient,
01032                                           fsal_op_context_t       * pcontext, 
01033                                           cache_inode_status_t    * pstatus) 
01034 {
01035   cache_inode_flag_t    tstflag ;
01036   cache_entry_t       * pentry_iter ;
01037   cache_entry_t       * pentry_to_read ;
01038   unsigned int          first_pentry_cookie = 0 ;
01039   unsigned int          i = 0 ;
01040   unsigned int          cookie_iter = 0 ;
01041   unsigned int          nbdirchain = 0 ;
01042   
01043   /* Set the return default to CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS */
01044   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
01045 
01046   /* end cookie initial value is the begin cookie */
01047   *pend_cookie = cookie ;
01048 
01049   /* stats */
01050   pclient->stat.nb_call_total += 1 ;
01051   pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_call[CACHE_INODE_READDIR] += 1 ;
01052 
01053 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFSPROTO
01054   printf( "--> Cache_inode_readdir: parameters are cookie=%u nbwanted=%u\n",  cookie, nbwanted ) ;
01055 #endif
01056 
01057   /* Sanity check */
01058   if( nbwanted == 0 )
01059     {
01060       /* Asking for nothing is not a crime !!!!! 
01061        * build a 'dummy' return in this case */
01062       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
01063       *pnbfound = 0 ;
01064       *peod_met = TO_BE_CONTINUED ;
01065       
01066       /* stats */
01067       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_success[CACHE_INODE_READDIR] += 1 ;
01068 
01069       return *pstatus ;
01070     }
01071   
01072   P_w( &dir_pentry->lock ) ;          
01073 
01074     /* Renew the entry (to avoid having it being garbagged */
01075   if( cache_inode_renew_entry( dir_pentry, NULL, ht, pclient, pcontext, pstatus ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01076     {
01077       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_retryable[CACHE_INODE_GETATTR] += 1 ;
01078       V_w( &dir_pentry->lock ) ;          
01079       return *pstatus ;
01080     }
01081 
01082   /* readdir can be done only with a directory */
01083   if( dir_pentry->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING &&
01084       dir_pentry->internal_md.type != DIR_CONTINUE )
01085     {
01086       V_w( &dir_pentry->lock ) ;
01087       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
01088 
01089       /* stats */
01090       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_READDIR] += 1 ;
01091   
01092       return *pstatus ;
01093     }
01094   
01095   /* Check is user (as specified by the credentials) is authorized to read the directory or not */
01096   if( cache_inode_access_no_mutex( dir_pentry, 
01097                                    FSAL_R_OK,
01098                                    ht,
01099                                    pclient, 
01100                                    pcontext,
01101                                    pstatus ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01102      {
01103        V_w( &dir_pentry->lock ) ;
01104        
01105        pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_retryable[CACHE_INODE_READDIR] += 1 ;
01106        return *pstatus ;
01107      }
01108 
01109   /* Is the directory fully cached (this is done if a readdir call if done on the directory) */
01110   if( dir_pentry->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
01111     { 
01112       if(  dir_pentry->object.dir_begin.has_been_readdir != CACHE_INODE_YES )
01113         {
01114 
01115            /* populate the cache*/
01116            if( cache_inode_readdir_populate( dir_pentry, 
01117                                              ht, 
01118                                              pclient, 
01119                                              pcontext, 
01120                                              pstatus ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01121              {
01122                /* stats */
01123                pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_READDIR] += 1 ;
01124          
01125                V_w( &dir_pentry->lock ) ;
01126                return *pstatus ;
01127              }
01128            
01129         }
01130 
01131        /* Compute fist cookie in readdir */
01132       first_pentry_cookie = 0 ;
01133     }
01134   else
01135     {
01136       /* DIR_CONTINUE */
01137       tstflag = dir_pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->object.dir_begin.has_been_readdir ;
01138 
01139       /* This test should see that "tstflag" is not CACHE_INODE_YES for a DIR_CONTINUE (if a DIR_CONTINUE exists, then 
01140        * it means that dir_chain was populated and this means a former call to cache_inode_readdir_populate. Later evolution
01141        * of the code could make 'has_been_readdir' returned from CACHE_INODE_YES to CACHE_INODE_NO during garbagge collection.
01142        * In this case, the following lines wil become necessary, but for now they are just here as 'defensive coding' */
01143       if( tstflag != CACHE_INODE_YES )
01144         {
01145 
01146           /* populate the cache*/
01147            if( cache_inode_readdir_populate(  dir_pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin, 
01148                                               ht, 
01149                                               pclient, 
01150                                               pcontext, 
01151                                               pstatus ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01152              {
01153                /* stats */
01154                pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_READDIR] += 1 ;
01155          
01156                V_w( &dir_pentry->lock ) ;
01157                return *pstatus ;
01158              }
01159            
01160         }
01161       
01162       /* Compute fist cookie in readdir */
01163       first_pentry_cookie = dir_pentry->object.dir_cont.dir_cont_pos * CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ;
01164     }
01165   
01166   /* Downgrade Writer lock to a reader one */
01167   rw_lock_downgrade( &dir_pentry->lock ) ;
01168 
01169   /* Now go through the pdir_chain for filling in dirent_array 
01170    * the first cookie is parameter 'cookie'
01171    * number of entries queried is set by parameter 'nbwanted'
01172    * number of found entries before eod is return is '*pnbfound' 
01173    * '*peod_met' is set if end of directory is encountered */
01174 
01175   /* Now, we can fill in the dirent array */
01176   *pnbfound = 0 ;
01177   *peod_met = TO_BE_CONTINUED ;
01178 
01179   /* Do we start to read the directory from the beginning ? */
01180   if( cookie == 0 )
01181     {
01182       /* First call: the two first entries should be '.' and '..' */
01183     }
01184   
01185 
01186   /* loop into the dirent array to locate the pdir_chain item related to the input cookie */
01187   nbdirchain = 0 ;
01188   pentry_to_read = dir_pentry ;
01189   
01190   while( cookie - first_pentry_cookie >= CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ) /* ????? */
01191     {
01192       nbdirchain += 1 ;
01193 
01194       if( pentry_to_read->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
01195         {
01196           /* if cookie - first_pentry_cookie is bigger than  CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE
01197            * then the provided cookie was far too big for this pdir_chain. The 
01198            * client to cache_inode tried to read beyond the end of directory.
01199            * In this case, return that EOD was met, but no entries found. */
01200           
01201           if( pentry_to_read->object.dir_begin.end_of_dir == END_OF_DIR )
01202             { 
01203                /* stats */
01204               pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_success[CACHE_INODE_READDIR] += 1 ;
01205 
01206                if( pentry_to_read->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
01207                  *pstatus = cache_inode_valid( pentry_to_read, CACHE_INODE_OP_GET, pclient ) ;
01208                else
01209                  *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
01210                
01211               V_r( &dir_pentry->lock ) ;
01212                
01213 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_READDIR
01214                printf( "Big input cookie found in cache_inode_readdir (DIR_BEGIN) : pentry=%p cookie=%d first_pentry_cookie=%d nbdirchain=%d\n", 
01215                        pentry_to_read, cookie, first_pentry_cookie, nbdirchain ) ;
01216 #endif
01217 
01218                /* Set the returned values */
01219                *pnbfound    = 0 ;
01220                *pend_cookie = cookie ;
01221                *peod_met    = END_OF_DIR ;
01222 
01223               return *pstatus ;
01224             }
01225           pentry_iter = pentry_to_read->object.dir_begin.pdir_cont ;
01226         }
01227       else
01228         {
01229           if( pentry_to_read->object.dir_cont.end_of_dir == END_OF_DIR )
01230             {
01231               V_r( &dir_pentry->lock ) ;
01232               
01233                /* stats */
01234                pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_success[CACHE_INODE_READDIR] += 1 ;
01235                
01236                /* OPeration is a success */
01237                *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
01238 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_READDIR
01239                printf( "Trouble found in cache_inode_readdir (DIR_CONTINUE) : pentry=%p cookie=%d first_pentry_cookie=%d nbdirchain=%d\n", 
01240                        pentry_to_read, cookie, first_pentry_cookie, nbdirchain ) ;
01241 #endif
01242                /* Set the returned values */
01243                *pnbfound    = 0 ;
01244                *pend_cookie = cookie ;
01245                *peod_met    = END_OF_DIR ;
01246                
01247                return *pstatus ;
01248             }
01249           pentry_iter = pentry_to_read->object.dir_cont.pdir_cont ;
01250         }
01251 
01252       pentry_to_read = pentry_iter ;
01253       
01254       /* At this step, pentry can't be something different of a DIR_CONTINUE,
01255        * becase  cookie - first_pentry_cookie >= CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE */
01256       first_pentry_cookie = pentry_to_read->object.dir_cont.dir_cont_pos * CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ;
01257       
01258     } /* while */
01259 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_READDIR  
01260   printf( "About to readdir in  cache_inode_readdir: pentry=%p cookie=%d first_pentry_cookie=%d nbdirchain=%d\n", 
01261           pentry_to_read, cookie, first_pentry_cookie, nbdirchain ) ;
01262 #endif
01263   /* Get prepaired for readdir */
01264 
01265   cookie_iter = cookie ;
01266   
01267   for( i = 0 ; i < nbwanted ; ) /* i is incremented when something is found */
01268     {
01269       if( pentry_to_read->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
01270         {
01271           if( pentry_to_read->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[cookie_iter % CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE].active == VALID )
01272             {
01273               /* another entry was add to the result array */
01274               dirent_array[i] = pentry_to_read->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[cookie_iter % CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE] ;
01275               cookie_array[i] = cookie_iter ;
01276 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE
01277               printf( "--> Cache_inode_readdir: Found slot with file named %s\n", 
01278                       pentry_to_read->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[cookie_iter % CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE].name.name ) ;
01279 #endif
01280               /* Step to next iter */
01281               *pnbfound += 1 ;
01282               i += 1 ;
01283               
01284             }
01285         }
01286       else
01287         {
01288           if( pentry_to_read->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[cookie_iter % CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE].active == VALID ) 
01289             {
01290               /* another entry was add to the result array */
01291               dirent_array[i] = pentry_to_read->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[cookie_iter % CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE] ;
01292               cookie_array[i] = cookie_iter ;
01293 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE
01294               printf( "--> Cache_inode_readdir: Found slot with file named %s\n", 
01295                       pentry_to_read->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[cookie_iter % CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE].name.name ) ;
01296 #endif
01297               /* Step to next iter */
01298               *pnbfound += 1 ;
01299               i +=1 ;
01300               
01301             }
01302         }
01303 
01304       /* Loop at next entry in dirent array */
01305       cookie_iter += 1 ;
01306       *pend_cookie = cookie_iter ;
01307 
01308       if( ( cookie_iter % CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ) == 0 )
01309         {
01310           /* It's time to step to the next dir_cont */
01311           if( pentry_to_read->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
01312             {
01313               if( pentry_to_read->object.dir_begin.end_of_dir == END_OF_DIR )
01314                 {
01315                   /* End of dir is reached */
01316                   *peod_met = END_OF_DIR ;
01317                   *pstatus  = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
01318                   V_r( &dir_pentry->lock ) ;
01319 
01320                   /* stats */
01321                   pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_READDIR] += 1 ;
01322 
01323                   return *pstatus ;
01324                 }
01325               pentry_iter =  pentry_to_read->object.dir_begin.pdir_cont ;
01326               pentry_to_read = pentry_iter ;
01327               /* cookie_iter = 0 ; */
01328             } 
01329           else
01330             {
01331               if( pentry_to_read->object.dir_cont.end_of_dir == END_OF_DIR )
01332                 {
01333                   /* End of dir is reached */
01334                   *peod_met = END_OF_DIR ;
01335                   *pstatus  = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
01336                   V_r( &dir_pentry->lock ) ;
01337 
01338                   /* stats */
01339                   pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_READDIR] += 1 ;
01340                
01341                   return *pstatus ;
01342                 }
01343               pentry_iter =  pentry_to_read->object.dir_cont.pdir_cont ;
01344               pentry_to_read = pentry_iter ;
01345               /* cookie_iter = 0 ; */
01346             }
01347         } /* if( cookie_iter == CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ) */
01348       
01349     } /* for( i = 0 ; i < nbwanted ; i ++ ) */
01350 
01351   
01352   if( pentry_to_read->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
01353     *pstatus = cache_inode_valid( pentry_to_read, CACHE_INODE_OP_GET, pclient ) ;
01354   else
01355     *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
01356   
01357   V_r( &dir_pentry->lock ) ;
01358 
01359   /* stat */
01360    if( *pstatus != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01361      pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_retryable[CACHE_INODE_READDIR] += 1 ;
01362    else
01363      pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_success[CACHE_INODE_READDIR] += 1 ;
01364   
01365   return *pstatus ;
01366 } /* cache_inode_readdir */
Generated on Tue Mar 31 14:37:28 2009 for Cache inode layer by  1.5.7.1
